00032 BOOST_XINT_INLINE char nToChar(int n, bool upperCase) {
00033     if (n < 10) return char(n+'0');
00034     else if (upperCase) return char((n - 10) + 'A');
00035     else return char((n - 10) + 'a');
00036 }
00037 
00038 BOOST_XINT_INLINE std::string to_string(const data_t n, size_t base, bool
00039     uppercase)
00040 {
00041     if (base<2 || base>36) throw exceptions::invalid_base();
00042 
00043     if (n.is_zero()) return "0";
00044 
00045     std::ostringstream out;
00046     if (base == 2 || base == 4 || base == 16) {
00047         // Fast no-division version, useful for debugging division and for cases
00048         // where maximum speed is necessary.
00049         const digit_t *firstDigit = n.digits(),
00050             *lastDigit = firstDigit + n.length - 1;
00051 
00052         if (n.negative) out << '-';
00053 
00054         int bits_per_base_b_digit = 0;
00055         while (base > 1) { base = base >> 1; ++bits_per_base_b_digit; }
00056         const digit_t mask = (doubledigit_t(1) << bits_per_base_b_digit) - 1;
00057 
00058         // Skip any leading zeros
00059         const digit_t *d = lastDigit;
00060         int digitShift = (bits_per_digit - bits_per_base_b_digit);
00061         while (digitShift >= 0 && ((*d >> digitShift) & mask) == 0)
00062             digitShift -= bits_per_base_b_digit;
00063 
00064         do {
00065             while (digitShift >= 0) {
00066                 out << nToChar((*d >> digitShift) & mask, uppercase);
00067                 digitShift -= bits_per_base_b_digit;
00068             }
00069 
00070             digitShift=(bits_per_digit - bits_per_base_b_digit);
00071         } while (d-- != firstDigit);
00072 
00073         return out.str();
00074     } else {
00075         // ATTN: for when there's nothing more pressing to do
00076         // This could be made a lot more efficient for very large numbers, by
00077         // dividing n by base raised to whatever number of digits will fit into
00078         // a doubledigit_t, then just doing single-digit divides for that many
00079         // digits before going back to n for another chunk. That would be
00080         // premature optimization though, so I'm just making this note instead.
00081         // If someone can show me a use-case where more efficiency is needed in
00082         // this function, I'll add it later.
00083 
00084         const data_t shift(n.new_holder(), base);
00085         data_t::divide_t a(divide(n.abs(), shift));
00086         do {
00087             out << nToChar(a.remainder[0], uppercase);
00088             a = divide(a.quotient, shift);
00089         } while (!a.quotient.is_zero());
00090         if (!a.remainder.is_zero()) out << nToChar(a.remainder[0], uppercase);
00091 
00092         if (n.negative) out << '-';
00093 
00094         std::string rval = out.str();
00095         std::reverse(rval.begin(), rval.end());
00096         return rval;
00097     }
00098 }
00099 
00100 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void data_t::from_string(const char *str, char **endptr,
00101     size_t base)
00102 {
00103     bool negate=false;
00104     const char *c = str;
00105 
00106     while (isspace(*c)) ++c;
00107 
00108     if (*c=='+') ++c;
00109     else if (*c=='-') { negate=true; ++c; }
00110 
00111     if (base==autobase) {
00112         if (*c=='0') {
00113             ++c;
00114             if (*c=='x' || *c=='X') {
00115                 ++c;
00116                 base=16;
00117             } else base=8;
00118         } else base=10;
00119     }
00120 
00121     if (base<2 || base>36) throw exceptions::invalid_base();
00122     if (*c==0) throw exceptions::invalid_digit("No valid digits");
00123 
00124     std::string tstr;
00125     if (negate) tstr.push_back('-');
00126     if (base <= 10) {
00127         const char p = char('0' + base);
00128         while (*c >= '0' && *c < p)
00129             tstr.push_back(*c++);
00130     } else {
00131         const char lower = char('a' + base - 10),
00132             upper = char('A' + base - 10);
00133         while ((*c >= '0' && *c <= '9')
00134             || (*c >= 'a' && *c < lower)
00135             || (*c >= 'A' && *c < upper))
00136                 tstr.push_back(*c++);
00137     }
00138     *endptr = const_cast<char*>(c);
00139 
00140     from_string(tstr, base);
00141 }
00142 
00143 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void data_t::from_string(const char *str, size_t slen, size_t
00144     base)
00145 {
00146     bool negate=false;
00147     const char *c = str;
00148     if (*c=='+') ++c;
00149     else if (*c=='-') { negate=true; ++c; }
00150 
00151     if (base==autobase) {
00152         if (*c=='0') {
00153             ++c;
00154             if (*c=='x' || *c=='X') {
00155                 ++c;
00156                 base=16;
00157             } else base=8;
00158         } else base=10;
00159     }
00160 
00161     if (base<2 || base>36) throw exceptions::invalid_base();
00162     if (*c==0) throw exceptions::invalid_digit("No valid digits");
00163 
00164     size_t max_bits_per_char = 1;
00165     while (max_bits_per_char < 6 && base > (1u << max_bits_per_char))
00166         ++max_bits_per_char;
00167 
00168     if (slen == 0) slen = strlen(str);
00169     size_t len = bits_to_digits(slen);
00170 
00171     const data_t shift(new_holder(), base);
00172 
00173     // ATTN: for when there's nothing more pressing to do
00174     // This function could use the same efficiency improvements that to_string
00175     // uses, but there's even less need for them here. Show me a use-case where
00176     // they're needed and I'll add them; until then, this will suffice.
00177 
00178     data_t digit(new_holder(), 0);
00179 
00180     beginmod(len);
00181     set(0);
00182 
00183     while (*c) {
00184         if (*c>='0' && *c<='9') digit.set(*c-'0');
00185         else if (*c>='A' && *c<='Z') digit.set(*c-'A'+10);
00186         else if (*c>='a' && *c<='z') digit.set(*c-'a'+10);
00187         else
00188             throw exceptions::invalid_digit("encountered non-alphanumeric "
00189             "character in string");
00190 
00191         if (digit >= shift) throw exceptions::invalid_digit("encountered digit "
00192             "greater than base allows");
00193 
00194         *this *= shift;
00195         *this += digit;
00196         ++c;
00197     }
00198 
00199     negative = negate;
00200     endmod();
00201 }
00202 
00203 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void data_t::from_string(const std::string& str, size_t base) {
00204     from_string(str.c_str(), str.length(), base);
00205 }

00207 BOOST_XINT_INLINE xint::binary_t to_binary(const data_t n, size_t bits) {
00208     if (bits > size_t(std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits)) throw
00209         exceptions::invalid_argument("can't fit that many bits into an "
00210         "unsigned character on this system");
00211     if (bits == 0) bits = std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits;
00212 
00213     bitqueue_t bitqueue;
00214     const digit_t *s = n.digits(), *se = s + n.length;
00215     while (s != se) bitqueue.push(*s++, bits_per_digit);
00216 
00217     xint::binary_t target;
00218     while (!bitqueue.empty()) target.push_back(static_cast<unsigned char>
00219       (bitqueue.pop(bits)));
00220     while (!target.empty() && target.back()==0) target.pop_back();
00221     return target;
00222 }
00223 
00224 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void data_t::from_binary(xint::binary_t b, size_t bits) {
00225     if (bits > size_t(std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits)) throw
00226         exceptions::invalid_argument("can't fit that many bits into an "
00227         "unsigned character on this system");
00228     if (bits == 0) bits = std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits;
00229 
00230     size_t len = bits_to_digits(b.size() * bits);
00231     beginmod(len);
00232 
00233     bitqueue_t bitqueue;
00234     for (xint::binary_t::const_iterator s = b.begin(), se = b.end(); s != se;
00235         ++s) bitqueue.push(*s, bits);
00236 
00237     digit_t *d = digits(), *t = d, *te = t + max_length();
00238     while (t != te && !bitqueue.empty())
00239       *t++ = static_cast<digit_t>(bitqueue.pop(bits_per_digit));
00240 
00241     length = (t - d);
00242 
00243     endmod();
00244 }
